title: An exciting Sans Sherif for a school visuel identity
content:
Hi all,

I’m currently for my final school project doing a visuel identity for a school called “The Academy of Professional Higher Education”. I’m on the lookout for a fresh, exciting sans sherif with a lot of character. I will be used both in the logotype and troughout the rest of the identity.

Does anyones of you type-specialists have an suggestion? :)

Thanks

 [‹ Font that is similar to Seravek](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925081021/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45033 "Go to previous forum topic") [Pictogram for Gratis ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925081021/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43578 "Go to next forum topic")
author: steeze

comments.content: If I was to do a logo for a professional academy I wouldn’t use a sans serif. Does the costume fit the occasion?

\>I will be used both in the logotype and troughout the rest of the identity.

This is not a great idea. Better get contrast with a differentiable typeface, or alter your chosen typeface for the same reason.

PS  
You made a wonderful misspelling, thanks – “Sans Sherif”. It’s memorized, “The Sans Sherif(f)”
